text:
Had a really great experience here on 6 Apr 2025 at 2+pm when they were closing. Order the plate below for $5.50 (3 meats: char siew, curry chicken and also stir fried lion mane mushrooms.)

Curry was super hot, portion was not stingy, and the lady provided me a bowl of hot herbal soup!

Menu attached for reference.

Only 1 vegetarian stall left as the other vegetarian stall closed in Sept
$4.3 for curry noodles with 1 egg. Very good serving , value for money.
However, a bit thirsty after meal which is normal for drinking curry gravy .
I tried the dumpling noodles previously and it was quite good @ $4.5
Parking is challenging due to the competition from nearby mosque. May need to park further at HDB and cross over .
Nice simple vegetarian stall at a neighborhood hawker centre. A good place to drop by if you are looking for affordable vegetarian dishes.

One of the 2 vegetarian stalls in this hawker centre. Sells Asian/ Chinese vegetarian food with no alliums. (*Food is mostly vegan, as it doesn’t contain dairy products. Only a handful dishes like Mee Siam contains eggs, but you can opt to have the eggs removed if you’re vegan)

Food is delicious and affordable, all below $5. Enjoy.

Food is less salty than other vegetarian stalls in Bukit Panjang Choa Chu Kang area, brown rice is offered, this is a great healthy food stall.

I come every Fri which has daily special nasi lemak with good chilli, egg, vegetarian nugget and cucumber of coz.

Fried bee hoon has good texture and tasty soya sauce, other vegetarian choices to go with fried bee hoon are good too.
